db.title: Database settings
db.description: Keys and values of all properties here depend on the database driver. Expected properties for MySQL are 'user', 'password', 'dbname', 'host' and 'port'.

driver.title: Database driver name.
driver.description: A Doctrine database driver, e.g. mysql or sqlite

enable-dev-entry-point.description: If the dev entry point should be enabled

bank-data-file.title: Bank data file
bank-data-file.description: Absolute or relative path to the file (including the file name). Needed for the kontocheck extension. Example: res/blz.lut2f

banned-ibans.title: List of banned IBANs
banned-ibans.description: List of IBANs that lead to a failed IBAN validation

web-basepath.title: Base URL
web-basepath.description: Base url of the application. Can be a full URL, a path (without trailing slash), or blank. All generated URLs in the HTML output will be relative to this path.

enable-cache.description: If template caching should be enabled

strict-variables.description: Make twig throw errors when templates refer to non-existing variables

loaders.title: Configuration for the different Twig template loaders.

template-dir.description: Paths to the templates, absolute or relative to application

array.title: Array loader configuration
array.description: Inline templates in the configuration for testing purposes. Template name is the object key, template content is the value.

default-layout-templates.title: Layout templates
default-layout-templates.description: Template names for defining parts of the site.

no-js-notice.title: JavaScript notice
no-js-notice.description: The notice that appears when the user has turned off JavaScript

i18n-base-path.title: Base path for i18n files
i18n-base-path.description: Base path for files related to internationalization. Must be a path (without trailing slash) that contains subfolders named according to the Locale ID defined in ICU (e.g. en_US).

contact-info.title: Contact information
contact-info.description: Names and email addresses for creating email recipients and senders

organization.title: Main Organization
organization.description: Main sender of email address. In case of WikiMedia Germany, this is mostly for memberships

suborganization.title: Sub-Organization
suborganization.description: Sender of email address. In case of WikiMedia Germany, this is for donations and subscriptions'

text-policies.title: Text policy templates
text-policies.description: Page names for black- and whitelists of different parts of the application. The pages must be stored in the content repository. They must contain words, each word in a separate line. Each "word" can also be a regular expression pattern.

fields.title: Address fields policy
fields.description: Page names for black- and whitelists of form fields (name, street, city, etc.). Blacklisted words lead to moderation of the donation/membership, not to blocking it

comment.title: Comment policy.
comment.description: Page names for black- and whitelists for comment texts. Blacklisted words lead to the moderation of the comment

email-address-blacklist.title: List of blocked e-mail addresses
email-address-blacklist.description: List of e-mail addresses that automatically mark data sets as deleted

locale.description: Default locale, used for formatting numbers and displaying texts

referrer-generalization.title: Referrer normalization
referrer-generalization.description: Configuration for normalizing the HTTP referrer URL into a manageable string for the donation tracking information

default.title: Default referrer
default.description: What referrer to use when no host name from domain-map matches.

domain-map.title: Referrer domain map
domain-map.description: Map several subdomains to one domain, e.g. www.wikipedia.org to en.wikipedia.org, etc

donation-minimum-amount.title: Minimum donation amount
donation-minimum-amount.description: Donations below this amount will be rejected.

donation-maximum-amount.title: Maximum donation amount
donation-maximum-amount.description: Donations exceeding this amount will be rejected.

subscription-interval.title: Minimum time between subscription submissions per user

donation-timeframe-limit.title: Minimum time between donation submissions per user

membership-application-timeframe-limit.title: Minimum time between membership applications per user

token-length.title: Access token length
token-length.description: Length of randomly generated one-time access tokens, for email confirmation etc. Generated tokens are hex representations of random bytes. Setting the length to 16 results in tokens with a length of 32 characters.

token-validity-timestamp.title: Access token life time duration
token-validity-timestamp.description: How long generated one-time access tokens are valid. Duration in ISO 8601 format, see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601#Time_intervals

purging-secret.title: Purging Secret
purging-secret.description: Secret parameter value for calling the "Purge Cache" page.

account-address.title: Paypal account email address
account-address.description: Email address associated with the PayPal account

notify-url.title: Payment notification URL
notify-url.description: Fundraising Application URL that gets called by PayPal for instant payment notifications (IPN)

return-url.title: Return URL
return-url.description: Fundraising Application URL the user gets returned to when her payment was successful

cancel-url.title: Cancel URL
cancel-url.description: Fundraising Application URL the user gets returned to when she cancels her payment on the PayPal page

item-name.title: Payment item name
item-name.description: The "item" that shows up in the payment, i.e. what is paid for

cancel-url.title: Cancel URL
cancel-url.description: Fundraising Application URL the user gets returned to when she cancels her payment on the PayPal page

item-name.description: The "item" that shows up in the payment, i.e. what is paid for

delay-in-days.title: Delay in days
delay-in-days.description: Number of days until the first payment will be made

base-url.title: Base URL
base-url.description: Base URL for the MCP iframe. The fundraising application will add various parameters to the URL, some of them defined in this section.

background-color.title: Background color
background-color.description: Iframe background color. Hex value, without leading hash

skin.title: Skin name
skin.description: TODO: This is probably a deprecated or misplaced config value.

theme.title: Theme name
theme.description: The CC payment form can be displayed in different skins (editable in the MCP backend).

return-url.title: Return URL
return-url.description: Fundraising Application URL the user gets sent to when her payment was successful

testmode.title: Testmode Flag
testmode.description: If the payment processing runs in test mode or not

sofort.title: Configuration for the Sofort√ºberweisung payment provider

campaigns.title: Campaign data with different confirmation pages

code.title: Campaign name
code.description: Campaign name, will be used in URL parameters

active.title: Active Flag
active.description: Set to true if campaign is active

templates.title: Template names
templates.description: Names of templates for the confirmation page, for A/B testing. One template will be randomly selected.

baseUrl.title: Tracker URL
baseUrl.description: Base URL for the Piwik installation. Make sure it starts with //, not with http:// or https://, that way the browser will automatically select the right transport when the URL is printed in a template

siteUrlBase.title: Site url
siteUrlBase.description: Base URL for server-side piwik tracking. It must *not* have a slash at the end

message-dir.title: Folder where the translation files are stored

payment-types.title: Known payment types and their configuration

donation-enabled.title: Donation Enabled Flag
donation-enabled.description: Set to true if payment type is to be offered for donations
